title.narrative: GENERATION OF STATISTICAL DATA

description.narrative: By 2022, the national statistical system will have strengthened its capacity to generate data and analytical evidence regarding the situation of children and adolescent., which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Evaluation, Research. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022 the most vulnerable children and adolescents, and especially girls, will have access to public policies and programmes that promote social inclusion and are supported by Dominican society

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, the national statistical system will have strengthened its capacity to generate data and analytical evidence regarding thesituation of children and adolescent.

description.narrative: UNICEF;in partnership with;the NSO;launched;the Executive Summary of the MICS;2019 survey, to inform public policy decisionmakers, the country’s UNSDCF and UNICEF’s new CPD. Thefinal draft of the general report was also produced, and publication is planned;for early 2022.The two main documents, both for the current and prospective;CPDs, the SITAN and the;GPR are in the final revision stage. Rounds four and five of the SEIA survey of COVID-19, were implemented, and six new studies;were published generating;evidence;for;both;humanitarian and development;programme components.;; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:11/01/2022
